title: Space Command Reaches FOC While “Home” Remains TBD
summary: U.S. Space Command reached Full Operational Capability (FOC) today, almost four-and-a-half years after it was reestablished by then-President Trump. Still undecided, however, is where USSPACECOM’s permanent home will be located. […]

title: Laser communication: the future of communicating in space
summary: Laser communications, an ever so important factor for the future of space exploration, has seen some important steps forward recently. Two test missions are on the way to provide important information, and a third one is planned for next year.

title: Satellite transmission power battle drags on after WRC-23
summary: International regulators have left the door open to relaxing a cap on satellite transmission power in non-geostationary orbit as soon as 2027, NGSO operators say, even as their geostationary peers assert any change has been blocked until at least four years later.

title: Federal agencies caught in environmental crossfire over Starship launches
summary: Several organizations have filed a new complaint about the environmental impacts of SpaceX Starship launches even as government agencies face criticism for delaying such launches for environmental reviews.

title: U.S. Space Command declares ‘full operational capability’
summary: U.S. Space Command, the Defense Department’s combatant command responsible for space operations, has achieved full operational capability, its commander Gen. James Dickinson announced Dec. 15.

title: China launches large classified optical satellite towards geostationary orbit
summary: China sent the classified Yaogan-41 satellite towards geostationary orbit Friday using the country’s largest rocket.

title: Daily Telescope: One of the most stunning Andromeda photos I’ve ever seen
summary: The image is the result of 100 hours of observing.

title: Electron returns to flight with successful launch of Japanese radar imaging satellite
summary: Rocket Lab successfully launched a Japanese radar imaging satellite on the first flight of its Electron rocket since a failure nearly three months ago.

title: MaiaSpace Completes First Kick Stage Engine Test
summary:
ArianeGroup subsidiary MaiaSpace has announced the completion of the first hot fire test of the engine that will power the company’s Colibri kick stage. The kick stage will be encased in a three-meter-tall fairing and will allow the launch startup to offer greater flexibility to its customers. To date, ArianeGroup has injected close to €40 […]
The post MaiaSpace Completes First Kick Stage Engine Test appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: Artemis II Crew Meets with Biden and Harris
summary: The Artemis II crew made an unannounced visit to the White House today, meeting with President Joe Biden and Vice President Kamala Harris. The President’s and Vice President’s schedules released […]
